data.title: Crash in js_cocos2dx_TextFieldTTF_textFieldWithPlaceHolder
data.body:
my android crashes sometimes for some of the users which i am able to see google developer console. 

Below is the crash log for the entire crash which i extracted out of google break pad. The crash clearly says that in the following function

> js_cocos2dx_TextFieldTTF_textFieldWithPlaceHolder

but i am not able to uderstand as to why this is happening. I am currently using cocos2dx-js v 3.5.

Any help or idea as to why this crash happens or how can i prevent this crash from happening would be highly useful 

```
Build fingerprint: 'motorola/falcon_bwaca/falcon_umts:4.4.4/KXB21.14-L1.50-1/1:user/release-keys'
pid: 30910, tid: 31705, name: Thread-6337 >>> in..test <<<
signal 6 (SIGABRT), code -6 (SI_TKILL), fault addr --------
Stack frame #00 pc 00022160 /system/lib/libc.so (tgkill+12)
Stack frame #01 pc 000131b1 /system/lib/libc.so (pthread_kill+48)
Stack frame #02 pc 000133c5 /system/lib/libc.so (raise+10)
Stack frame #03 pc 000120fb /system/lib/libc.so
Stack frame #04 pc 00021a14 /system/lib/libc.so (abort+4)
Stack frame #05 pc 00c41251 libcocos2djs.so (__gnu_cxx::__verbose_terminate_handler()+228): Routine js_cocos2dx_TextFieldTTF_textFieldWithPlaceHolder(JSContext*, unsigned int, JS::Value*) at jsb_cocos2dx_auto.cpp:60716
```

data.title: RichText being affected by syntax errors on unrelated lines
data.body:
Using the following Sonar Systems tutorial source:
https://github.com/SonarSystems/Cocos2d-JS-v3-Tutorial-78---UIRichText

After compiling and and running on an Android device (Fire HD 7) running the latest firmware I am unable to see any RichText elements. I'm using the latest version of Cocos2D (3.9), latest JDK, latest Android SDK, ANT 1.9.4, and NDK r10c.

**Edit:**
It appears the syntax used to instantiate the Sprite is keeping RichText from being processed correctly. When changing from "new cc.Sprite.create()" to "new cc.Sprite()" the RichText is properly handled. These two elements are completely unrelated and an error in the syntax of one should not affect the other.

data.title: CCDownloader on iOS is broken in v3.9
data.body:
The `onDataTaskSuccess` callback is never called for a data download task. You can reproduce this in the Downloader Test, Top Left test in cocos2d-x v3.9 cpp-tests project.

Inside CCDownloader-apple.mm it just looks like `onTaskFinish` callback is never called for a data task.

Related issue #14533

data.title: Fix Downloader bug iOS & Android
data.body:
## Problem

After upgrading my employer's game from Cocos2d-x 3.8.1 to 3.9, the AssetManagerEx failed to work properly. After some investigation I fixed 2 bugs that lies in the new iOS & Android native Downloaders. 

The game involved has 3000+ asset files managed by the AssetManagerEx.
### iOS https://github.com/cezheng/cocos2d-x/commit/ecf94a3dc4fbfd3e9764021657713ec21a527e4d

Upon calling NSURLSessionDownloadTask's resume, the task's timeout
countdown starts. When the AssetManagerEx starts downloading, it creates
all the tasks all at once and just `resume` upon creation. When the
number of asset files is very large, later tasks tend to end up in
'request timed out -1001' error before they can even start downloading.
This commit adds a buffer queue to prevent all the NSURLSessionTasks to
start all at once.

> Without this fix, our game was able to download 1200 of the 3000+ files(which means in the default timeout setting, we were able to download 1200 files while the other 2000 files timedout without even starting)
### Android https://github.com/cezheng/cocos2d-x/commit/d174a98afa20abf1e6c949d1571c966af977d4d8

When the AssetManagerEx start downloading, it used to create all the
download tasks all at once. When the app has a large number of asset
files, it is likely to crash due to out of memory when creating threads
for each of the download tasks. This commit adds a buffer queue to the
downloader to use the `countOfMaxProcessingTasks` property from hints,
preventing all the tasks from starting all at once.

> Without this fix, the downloader seems to be creating a lot of threads all at once causing out of memory error.

data.title: Add enum value for no key
data.body: Add enum value for "none" key just like KEY_NONE in EventKeyboard::KeyCode enum so that you don't have to cast 0 to Controller::Key.

data.title: Improve CCController
data.body: Include CCController headers in cocos2d.h, make the controller key code "enum class" (just like in EventKeyboard) and add a constant "KEY_NONE" for no key (also as in EventKeyboard).

data.title: Touch bug on Mac
data.body:
I'm using v3.6 but think this one is unlikely to have been fixed in later versions of Cocos2d-x.

The wrong position is passed to onTouchBegan( cocos2d::Touch *touch, cocos2d::Event *event ).
This only seems to happen on the Mac (not tried win32 though).

Steps to reproduce:
- Start your application
- DO NOT move your mouse cursor
- Click using the mouse

The call to your onTouchBegan( cocos2d::Touch *touch, cocos2d::Event *event ) gives the wrong position.

All is fine if you move the mouse before clicking.

data.title: cocos2d::ui Nodes ignore anchor point positions when adding children
data.body:
When getting a cocos2d::ui element like so: 

```
cocos2d::ui::PageView* pgv_asset_preview = static_cast<cocos2d::ui::PageView*>(root_node->getChildByName("pgv_asset_preview"));
```

And later on if we add a sprite via

```
                    auto asset = cocos2d::Sprite::create(texture_path);
                    pgv_asset_preview->addChild(asset, 128);
```

We are forced to change the children position like so: 

```
asset->setPosition(pgv_asset_preview->getSize().width * 0.5,
                  pgv_asset_preview->getSize().height * 0.5);

```

Both anchor points are (0.5, 0.5).

data.title: "libwebsockets not configured for ssl" when using Firebase
data.body:
Hello. I am trying to make cocos2d-js to work with Firebase.

In browser it all works fine. But when I compile it on iOS device I get this error:

```
[33:9087] ERR: libwebsockets not configured for ssl
```

The whole message:

```
[WebSocket::init] _host: luminous-torch-3436.firebaseio.com, _port: 80, _path: /.ws?v=5
[33:9079] NOTICE: Initial logging level 7
[33:9080] NOTICE: Library version: 1.3 762deb8
[33:9081] NOTICE: IPV6 compiled in and enabled
[33:9081] NOTICE: libev support not compiled in
[33:9081] NOTICE:  static allocation: 4456 + (12 x 256 fds) = 7528 bytes
[33:9086] NOTICE:  canonical_hostname = thevipaz
[33:9086] NOTICE:  per-conn mem: 116 + 1594 headers + protocol rx buf
[33:9087] ERR: libwebsockets not configured for ssl
[33:9087] NOTICE: libwebsocket_context_destroy
```

Is there a way to make Firebase and Cocos2d-x work together?

Thank's for help.
